title: Ed Sheeran thinks he’s meeting Prince Harry to defend gingers
text:
They are not fighting to ‘change the perception of people with Moroccan sunset hair’ (Picture: Sussex Royal)

The Duke of Sussex and Ed Sheeran have teamed up for World Mental Health Day and are urging people to ‘look out for anybody that might be suffering in silence’.

But the pair appear to have had a bit of a misunderstanding in a video shared on the SussexRoyal Instagram account today.

Harry opens his door to Ed and they seem to be on the same page when they talk about working together and how ‘passionate’ they are about their cause.

The duke says: ‘This for me is a subject of conversation that’s just not talked about enough.

‘I think people all over the world are really suffering.’

Ed Sheeran looks excited as he grooms himself before heading to Harry’s (Picture: Sussex Royal)

Ed, 28, says he’s been working on a song to try and get the message out to the wider public – so far so good.

But Harry, 35, looks a bit puzzled when his guest says: ‘People just don’t understand what it’s like for people like us.

‘You know the jokes, the snide comments. I just feel like it’s time that we stood up and and said “We’re not going to take this any more. We are ginger – and we’re gonna fight”.’

The penny drops and Harry explains there has been a mix up and that their collaboration was meant to be about World Mental Health Day.

Ed says: ‘Yeah yeah, of course, I definitely knew that,’ as he sheepishly deletes the words ‘Gingers Unite’ from a presentation on his laptop.

The document also says: ‘HRH Prince Harry and the king of ging Ed Sheeran get together to change the perception of people with Moroccan sunset hair.’

The duke answers the door and jokes about how ‘it’s like looking in the mirror’ (Picture: Sussex Royal)

The pair are asking people to check on their loved ones if they worry about their mental health (Picture: Sussex Royal)

At the end of the clip, sitting next to Ed on a sofa, Harry says: ‘Guys, this World Mental Health Day, reach out, make sure that your friends, strangers – look out for anybody that might be suffering in silence. We’re all in this together.’

The video has racked up nearly 1.4 million views in four hours and is captioned with the message: ‘Both Prince Harry and Ed Sheeran want to ensure that not just today but every day, you look after yourself, your friends and those around you.

‘There’s no need to suffer in silence, share how you’re feeling, ask how someone is doing and listen for the answer.

‘Be willing to ask for help when you need it and know that we are all in this together. #WMHD.’

Yesterday a teaser of the video was posted showing Ed being greeted by a casually dressed duke after setting off his God Save The Queen doorbell.

As the two red-headed men stand there in their matching grey polo shirts, Harry jokes about how ‘it’s like looking in the mirror’.

description: Prince Harry and Ed Sheeran are campaigning for World Mental Health Day, but Ed had other ideas in a clip on the SussexRoyal Instagram page.
